speaker: Skyline
text: A helicopter rises above the city._  **PREVIOUSLY ON FRASIER**

speaker: Frasier
text: What's got Daphne all worked up now?

speaker: Niles
text: It wasn't Daphne.  It was Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: She's gotten involved with some Argentine polo player. It turns out [ ] he's a gold digger, with a violent temper to boot.

speaker: Esteban
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes?

speaker: Esteban
text: I'm Esteban de Rojo. [_He punches Frasier._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Daphne_] I tell you, Maris will never come between us again. _As they exit to the kitchen, we hear the radio: "And now, news headlines: Police have just arrested Seattle socialite Maris Crane for the murder of Argentine polo star Esteban de Rojo..."  The radio fades out._   _Scene One - The Montana It is later that night, after everyone has heard the news.  Niles opens the door to Frasier and Martin._

speaker: Niles
text: Come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles! [_they embrace_] What have you heard?

speaker: Niles
text: Not much.  The TV news is still pretty sketchy.  Dad, did you find anything out?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I called some buddies at the station.  They'll call back when they know something. _Frasier and Martin hang up their coats and head for the bar, to which Daphne has brought some plastic cups and where there are still refreshments left over from the fake baby shower._

speaker: Daphne
text: It's just so freaky!  I can't believe that man is dead. He was standing right where you are just a few hours ago.

speaker: Martin
text: How are you holding up, son?

speaker: Frasier
text: As well as can be expected. [_He moves his hand to his eye._]

speaker: Martin
text: I meant your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, I'm--I'm stunned of course, the idea that Maris actually killed someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we've all seen her murder many a lively dinner party.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Martin
text: That's terrible.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, I'm joking.  And haven't I earned the right to my gallows humor? [_haunted voice_] After all, are you forgetting that just this afternoon I was punched in the face by a man now dead?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_handing a glass to Niles_] Here, drink this.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello? [_pause_] Yes, of course.  I'll be there shortly. [_He hangs up._] It's the police.  They want to talk to me.

speaker: Daphne
text: My God, why?  They don't suspect you of anything, do they?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't think so, I don't think they could, they couldn't, could they?  Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Calm down.  You had lunch with her today.  They just want to know what you talked about.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what did we talk about?  What did we talk about?  Uh, we-we discussed the upcoming women's arts festival and their tableau vivant.  They're going to be re-enacting Schmitt's painting of "The Martyrdom of St. Ursula by Atila the Hun." Naturally, Maris will pose as the Hun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Niles
text: A tad Germanic for my taste, but nonetheless I told her I'd help out by lending her my antique crossbow to help complete the tragic scene on the Rh�ne.  Of course, talk of the Rh�ne inevitably led to that wonderful anecdote about the Nazarene painters of Biddlesbock Palace...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_joins Niles in loud guffaws_] Those beer-loving rascals!  Tell it, Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: _No_!  What did she say about the polo guy?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I-I told you, she mentioned she felt unsafe around him, and she thought that he only wanted her for her money, and I urged her to end the relationship.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's pretty tame stuff.  It'll take more than a little lunch to tie you into a murder.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  Niles, they're in front of Maris's house now.

speaker: Announcer
text: There's been a startling new development in the society murder case.  Sources say alleged murderer Maris Crane killed her polo-playing lover, Esteban de Rojo, with an antique crossbow...

speaker: Daphne
text: You gave her the murder weapon!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello? [_aside_] It's a reporter.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not home.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_into phone_] I'm sorry, he's not here, and I don't know when he's coming back. [_pause_] I'd rather not say. [_another pause_] I'd rather not say! [_charmed_] Oh, thank you, Manchester, actually.

speaker: Martin
text: Hang up!

speaker: Daphne
text: Goodbye. [_does_]

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe this.  It's an unlisted number.  They must think I'm involved somehow.  Th-they're actually trying to imply that...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, I'm not going to panic.  The only way to get through this is to remain calm.

speaker: Martin
text: Right, now, let's go on down to the station and get this all sorted out.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm coming too.

speaker: Niles
text: No!  You have to rest up for our doctor's appointment tomorrow morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll stay with Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't worry.  Everything's going to be fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, that's going to go on all night.  Do you want to just stay at my place?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thanks, but if I have them drive me out of me own home, then they've won.

speaker: Frasier
text: Allow me. [_He answers._] Hello?  Yes, I'll tell her. [_hangs up_] That was your mother.  She heard the news, she's on her way over.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll pack a bag, you get the car. _She heads to the back as Frasier goes out the door.  FADE OUT_  **FRAZER WITH A "Z"**  _Scene Two - Frasier's apartment Martin and Niles enter and Daphne receives them._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we survived!  The kid held up.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_embracing him_] What took you all night?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, there was a lot of waiting.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_helping Niles with his coat_] Here, let me take that.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  Fortunately we found a nice cold metal bench between two drunk bikers and a pimp who called me "Peaches."

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and the interesting thing happened when we were leaving. We ran into Maris's lawyer on the way out.

speaker: Niles
text: And he told us the whole story.  Apparently, Maris and Esteban had a fight, and Maris kicked him out.  She was trying to calm herself by practicing her tableau vivant pose with the, with the crossbow.  Which, she needs all the practice she can get. She has terribly weak triceps.  Well, all of a sudden Esteban burst back in through the balcony window.  Maris was-was startled to death and pulled the trigger in self-defense. He was dead before he hit the parquet.

speaker: Daphne
text: So where is she now?

speaker: Martin
text: They're holding her as a flight risk.

speaker: Niles
text: Can you imagine?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it didn't help that when they found her, she had a passport, a wig, and $10,000 in her purse.

speaker: Niles
text: Maris always has those things in her purse.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you've got to admit, Niles, it doesn't look very good.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't believe she could have planned this.  You do learn something about a woman when you've slept in a room next to hers for fifteen years.  [_N.B. Actually less time - Niles and Maris dated for three years, lived together in marriage for eleven, and were separated for two before he finally filed for divorce, which took another two years -- Mike Lee_] _They are all uncomfortable and irritated, particularly Daphne.  A thump on the door is heard._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that must be the paper.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, she just happened to be posing with a loaded crossbow at the exact moment he burst in on her?

speaker: Niles
text: And don't you just know the prosecutor is going to try to twist that into something sinister?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  It's on the front page.

speaker: Martin
text: They don't mention Niles, do they?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let me see.  Ah, here we are, yes. [_reading_] Uh, "Maris Crane is believed to have gotten the crossbow from her ex- husband, Dr. Niles Crane, with whom she lunched on the day of the murder."

speaker: Martin
text: [_looking over shoulders at the paper_] Is that you and Maris on your honeymoon?

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, that is the experimental liposuction center in Gstaad. [_wistfully_] So, yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: "According to sources, Crane divorced the accused some years ago to marry her plastic surgeon, whom he left in order... to marry..."  Oh, dear.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_snatching the paper_] "To marry Daphne Moon... a housekeeper." Oh, that's just lovely.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, now, the press is notorious for getting things wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Niles is right.  For example look, further on here it says, ha-ha, "Dr. Crane is the brother of local deejay, Frazer--with a 'Z'--Crane."  You just have to laugh these things off.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I can't laugh.  That horrible woman has managed to slither her way back into our lives.

speaker: Niles
text: No, she is not back in our life.  This whole thing is going to blow over in no time.

speaker: Daphne
text: How can you be so calm?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, in situations such as this, there are only two ways to react: either you go to pieces or you stay calm, and I've chosen to do the latter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bravo, Niles, that's very healthy.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you'd better go home, son, and get some sleep, you've had a long night.

speaker: Niles
text: That is a good idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll call you later.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you. [_with forced enthusiasm_] Oh!  We have your doctor's appointment this morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't worry, you don't have to come.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  And miss hearing my baby's heartbeat?  I don't think so. [_naively_] Plenty of time to sleep after the baby's born.  _Niles and Daphne exit.  FADE TO:_  **FAIR AND UNBALANCED**  _Scene Three -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier, Niles, and Roz are sitting down_

speaker: Roz
text: Niles, how are you holding up?

speaker: Niles
text: Apart from the lack of sleep, I'm all right.  Although, now that it's in the news that I provided the crossbow I can't go anywhere without people whispering and pointing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, excuse me. [_answers_] Hello?  Hello, Maris.  Oh, I'm-I'm so sorry.  That's awful.  I'll-I'll-I'll do what I can.  All right. [_hangs up_] Oh, that was Maris.  Poor thing lost her shoes.

speaker: Niles
text: She put them outside her cell to be polished, and... someone named Big Judy is holding them for ransom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how often does she call you?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, more often than you'd think she could, being in jail.

speaker: Roz
text: Hasn't she made your life hard enough?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I can't turn my back on her now, Roz, she's literally fighting for her life. _Engine noises are heard outside, and Niles glances out the window. He glances out the window_

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wonderful.  More news vans.  Maybe it's time I made a statement. [_starts to rise_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, absolutely not, Niles. That is the worst possible thing you could do.  It would only fan the flames.  I'll tell you what.  Why don't you slip out the back way, and I will talk to them for you.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that... there's no need, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, I insist.  I'm used to dealing with these media jackals.  You have no idea how they can twist your words with editing tricks and such.  All right, off you go.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Frasier.

speaker: Reporter
text: Is Niles Crane in here?

speaker: Frasier
text: He is not.  I will be speaking on his behalf.  Gentlemen, you may roll tape. [_He prepares for his delivery._] Good afternoon, Seattle,  this is Dr. Frasier Crane, spokesman for the Crane family.

speaker: Frasier
text: Recent events involving my brother, Niles Crane and his ex-wife are tragic, almost as tragic as the _rampant_ media speculation concerning his involvement.  If there is any justice in the world, Maris Crane and Niles Crane will soon be executed.  Thank you, that is all I have to say. _He returns to his table as the camera crew begins to leave, in a buzz of excitement.  Roz quickly whispers in his ear._

speaker: Frasier
text: I said no such thing.  I did?  I did.  Excuse me?  Excuse me! Come back!  _FADE OUT as Frasier runs after the press corps.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four - Frasier's apartment Frasier and Martin are watching the news._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] Maris Crane and Niles Crane will soon be executed.

speaker: Martin
text: That's four times in one newscast.  Must be some kind of record.

speaker: Frasier
text: They know I meant "exonerated." _He covers his face and groans.  Niles and Daphne enter.  They are not amused._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, Niles.  Listen, I'm, I'm so sorry about today's little gaffe.  You know what I meant.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't worry.  Anyone can make a little slip.  We know you were only trying to ruin our lives--[_feigning self-correction_] I mean, help.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, once again, I'm so sorry...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Frasier, please, it's all right.  I should have talked to them myself.  I hope it'll be all right if we stay with you for a while.

speaker: Martin
text: Why?  What happened?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, since Frasier's little press conference, the media frenzy has only increased.  It's become a nuisance for our neighbors.  TV crews, news helicopters, plus the entire press corps from Esteban's hometown in Argentina.

speaker: Daphne
text: Last night some cheeky bloke from the _Buenos Aires Herald_ climbed a tree and took a picture of old Mrs. Gottschalk in her _sitz_ bath.

speaker: Niles
text: Apparently, the readership of the _Herald_ is mostly lonely gauchos.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, your good cheer in spite of everything is just remarkable.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I've chosen not to let it get to me, and it hasn't. Of course, most of the credit goes to my Daphne.  I'm truly blessed to have such a loving and supportive wife.  She is at once my huggle-bunny and my rock.

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I might throw up.

speaker: Niles
text: Huggle-bunny was a bit much.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, my stomach is upset.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, can I get you something?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you, Frasier.  I wouldn't mind ten years in prison-- oh, I meant crackers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, I-I guess I deserved that, but may I remind you I'm a bit of a victim myself... [_haunted voice_] as just yesterday I was punched in the face by a man... now dead.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?  Hello, Mm--M [_swallowing it_] No, no I haven't forgotten.  Yes, I'll try to get there tomorrow morning. All right, goodbye, Mm... [_He hangs up._]

speaker: Daphne
text: That was Maris, wasn't it?  Where will you be tomorrow morning?

speaker: Niles
text: [_guiltily_] The jail.  I-I-I said I'd try to visit her...

speaker: Daphne
text: Have you lost your bloody mind?  I have tried to be patient, but this is too much! [_rising_]  You promised me that woman would be out of our lives!  Now she's calling every minute, the papers reporting as though you two are still married, and I can't even sleep in my own bed!

speaker: Niles
text: I know, darling, b-but you can't blame me for everything that's happened.

speaker: Daphne
text: The hell I can't!  If you hadn't have snuck off to have lunch with her, we never would have been dragged into this, and you wouldn't be sleeping alone on the couch tonight!  But you did, and we were, so you are! [_passing Frasier_] I hate that kind of cracker!

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, that was kind of harsh.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll say, these are imported from Belgium.

speaker: Niles
text: Poor thing, she's over-tired and a little hormonal.  I'll-I'll go try to talk her into choosing to be calm.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, he's really holding up well.

speaker: Frasier
text: A little too well.  I'm starting to fear he's not dealing with his emotions at all.

speaker: Martin
text: Right.  That's the whole secret to holding up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, it's called "repression" and it is not healthy.  The man is a walking pressure-cooker.  It's his senior year all over again.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's right.  He swore me to secrecy. [_beat_] Well...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles got mono and he missed four weeks of class, right? So, he was studying around the clock trying to catch up. Just before finals, his girlfriend dumped him - for his roommate.  Niles insisted he was just fine - right up until the very moment when they found him in the all-night grocery, sitting in a freezer bin talking to a bag of frozen corn, whispering "Why so cold, my love?" _Niles re-enters, carrying bedding.  His cheerfulness is becoming increasingly taut._

speaker: Niles
text: All calm!

speaker: Martin
text: Want me to help you make up the couch?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I can manage.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, well, I think I'll hit the rack too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sherry, Niles? [_holds out a glass_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, how lovely, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: To the balcony?

speaker: Niles
text: Mm, after you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, while I admire your initial fortitude, I can't help thinking you may have taken things to extremes.  As you know, it can be dangerous to repress one's emotions.

speaker: Niles
text: True, but there is no way of weathering a situation like this without a certain degree of detachment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure you're not too detached?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, nonsense, everything's under control.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look at that!

speaker: Frasier
text: What in the hell?!

speaker: Niles
text: [_shouting_] Just a news chopper.  Pay it no mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_yelling over the rotors_] That doesn't bother you?!

speaker: Niles
text: You get used to it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for heaven's sake, get inside! [_shouting at the helicopter_] You should be ashamed of yourselves!  You know perfectly well I meant EXONERATED!!  _He goes back inside.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Caf e Nervosa Niles approaches the counter.  Roz is there.  Niles is still wearing his suit, but looking very haggard._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Niles!  A cappuccino, please.  And one for him. You don't look so good.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I didn't get much sleep last night--again.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm surprised you're here after yesterday.

speaker: Niles
text: I refuse to be cowed into changing my routines.  Let me get this.  I have my coffee, I go to work.  Of course, all my patients want to talk about is Maris. [_mechanically dropping bills on the counter_] Esteban's crazed brother left me a message saying I owe him some sort of blood debt. [_chuckles_] I tell you, some days it just doesn't pay to get off the sofa. [_He adjusts his kinked neck._]

speaker: Roz
text: You've had it pretty rough.

speaker: Niles
text: What are my choices?  I can go to pieces or I can bear up and live my normal life.  Can I get a straw, please?

speaker: Waitress
text: Oh sorry, sir, that was the last one.

speaker: Niles
text: I see. [_with meaning_] The last straw.  Gosh, is it warm in here? [_He begins to loosen his tie._] It is.  It is.  It's warm in here.  Oh, it's suffocating. [_He removes his tie._] There, that's better.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll get you a straw, Niles.  Do you need a straw?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no, you heard her.  There are no more straws.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that feels so much better! [_He begins to untuck his shirt._] Oh, everything was just so tight before!  He is now unbuttoning his shirt, straining with the last buttons.

speaker: Niles
text: Ahh, ye-es!  Oh!  Coffee shop without straws? [_giggles maniacally_] It makes no sense! _He has removed his shirt, revealing his undershirt.  He then reaches down and tosses away his shoes._

speaker: Roz
text: You can borrow my straw, see?

speaker: Niles
text: [_loosening his belt and removing his pants_] Oh, this is great!  I was being smothered!  Oh, I can breathe.  I don't know how you stand it! _Niles hops out of view as he removes his pants, wearing only his undershirt, shorts, and socks.  By now of course, everyone is staring at him in horror.  Roz desperately makes a call on her mobile._

speaker: Roz
text: Hello, Frasier, it's me.  How close are you to the cafe? All right, well hurry up and park because Niles is almost completely... _She looks.  Niles is now seated at the window, not wearing a thing, and "hiding" behind the newspaper he's calmly reading._

speaker: Roz
text: Niles is completely naked! [_She hangs up and approaches him._] Oh... Niles!

speaker: Barista
text: I'm calling the cops.

speaker: Roz
text: The hell you are!  This man's tips alone have probably paid for all the pot you'll ever smoke.  Just back off, cowboy! And that goes for the rest of you, too. _Frasier rushes in.  Roz indicates Niles.  Frasier approaches him and sits._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_still reading the paper_] Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on?

speaker: Niles
text: Heat wave in Texas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, Niles, maybe you should put some clothes on.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah... nah.  No, too much, too much on me.  I'm feeling very constricted. [_Frasier gently reaches out_] I'm fine now, don't touch me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, look at yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello! [_chuckles_] I think I'm having that dream where I'm naked in Nervosa!

speaker: Frasier
text: I think a lot of people are having that dream.  We have to go now, Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: But! - you're not getting in my car like that.

speaker: Roz
text: Is he okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just a panic attack.  It's happened before, but he's never been quite this close to butterfly-net territory.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the Barista_] May I have your apron, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the waitress_] And, and yours? _She also surrenders her apron.  Frasier gives Niles's clothes to Roz, then carries the aprons over._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles.  I'm going to wrap you up like a big, green Christmas present.  You like Christmas, don't you? _He places one apron over Niles's head, covering his front. Niles rises._

speaker: Frasier
text: There we are.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, okay. _Frasier covers Niles's backside with the other apron as Roz delivers the following speech._

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, listen up!  Me and my friends are going to back out of here, nice and easy.  As far as any of you are concerned, this never happened.  And if any of you decide to be a hero and call the police... trust me, I will find you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow, Roz, that was persuasive.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, well, there's nothing worse than waking up naked with a bunch of cops standing around.  I've been there... _Roz and Frasier escort Niles out, as Roz starts to tell the story.  FADE TO:  Scene Six - The Montana Martin, Daphne, and Frasier are seated.  Niles comes down the stairs in his bathrobe._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, there he is!  Rise and shine, lazybones!

speaker: Niles
text: [_still being calm_] I'm surprised it's still light out. I thought it would be dark by now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it was already.  You've been asleep for twenty hours.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, I guess I needed it.

speaker: Daphne
text: So how are you feeling?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, much better.  Frasier, I'm so sorry I embarrassed you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, you didn't embarrass me one bit.  Well, maybe just a little... On our way to the car the breeze from a passing school bus turned your apron into a cape, and...

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello? [_She covers the mouthpiece._] It's Maris.  You don't have to take this.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I really should. [_taking the phone_] Hello, Maris!  Yes, yes, listen, there's something I want to say...Yes, but...

speaker: Niles
text: [_losing his patience_] Well, of course you're alone!  You're alone because you killed your boyfriend!

speaker: Niles
text: Now, I am on your side, but there is a limit because I have a wonderful, pregnant wife, and as far as my attention is concerned, she comes first, always!  I will help you through this, but now, you have to help me by saying goodbye.  No, no, no, what do you have to say?  Yes, goodbye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Now there's the Niles that's been missing in action.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks for what you said about me, though I haven't been completely wonderful.

speaker: Niles
text: [_zero tolerance_] No, you've been irritable and you made me sleep on a couch.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the stuff, Niles, doesn't it feel good to get it off your chest?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, stuff it, Mr. Malaprop!  Family spokesman, the Manson family should have a spokesman like you!

speaker: Martin
text: [_delighted_] He's really getting the hang of this, isn't he?

speaker: Niles
text: And you!  I'd have been home from that jail an hour earlier if you hadn't convinced your buddies to let you squeeze off a few rounds into a dumpster!

speaker: Daphne
text: You kept him waiting while I was at home worried sick?!

speaker: Martin
text: I was doing him a favor!  I was keeping him away from you and your hormones.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, some favor!  Making me stay with Frasier!  He made me do housework!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd forgotten that until this moment!

speaker: Niles
text: You made her do housework!

speaker: Frasier
text: I did no such thing!

speaker: Martin
text: A pregnant woman?!  That's pretty low!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_self-righteous_] Oh, fine!  Fine!  Turn your anger on me. It's almost as if you'd forgotten that [_haunted voice_] not three days ago I was punched in the face by a man now dead.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you! [_then_] Now who wants pancakes?  _They all answer in the affirmative and move to the kitchen.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT TWO_
